title: Stay as a Senior Engineer or Pursue a Leadership Role?
description: In response to a fellow engineer's question, I offer five reasons I hope she'll take the leap into management and leadership.

title: Do you have imposter syndrome? It's ok.
description:
Work and life are riddled with overwhelming experiences. It's ok. No one expects you to have all the answers. 

Here's some guidance to help you navigate situations when you feel like you're in over your head.

title: The Most Memorable Advice I Ever Received: Re-Introducing Yourself
description: I've heeded this advice countless times since I got it back in college. It's a tiny change, but has a huge impact.

title: 4 Tips for a Great Power Nap
description: After a productive morning of work, I'll frequently take a quick siesta (power nap!) to recharge in the afternoon. What tips do YOU have?

title: Break This Habit When Communicating Software Architecture | Engineering Leadership
description: Don't try to blow me away with your technical architecture. It's not working.

title: How to Communicate Effectively as a Leader
description: Just because you SAID it does not mean that you COMMUNICATED it.  Speaking and email-sending are only half the story!

title: Tell someone today... | Engineering Leadership
description: Everyone likes to feel appreciated now and again. #leadership #gratitude #appreciation #thanks #relationships

title: Should I Leave My Job?  | Make the Leap
description: Do you already have a job you like BUT you have a new job opportunity to consider? Worried about leaving your current team behind? I've mentored SO many people who've been in this situation. Maybe this is the little nudge you needed?

title: One Simple Trick to Get Motivated and Feel Accomplished
description: Set the bar low each day, and raise it as you build solid habits.

title: Company is a Chaotic Mess: Should You Leave?
description: You're a tech lead (software developer) in a disorganized company that is rife with chaos. Should you resign? As always, it depends. Here are 3 paths you can follow.

title: Bad Manager or Bad Person? There's a Difference.
description: No doubt, bad managers abound, but management failings can be fixed. By contrast, beware people with deep-seeded toxic traits.

title: 7 Keys to Build a Great Company Culture
description: You're founding a business? Build a strong, well-loved company by being intentional about its culture.

title: Long Live the Feedback Sandwich | Interrupting Direct Report Followup
description: Delivering feedback in a positive - constructive - positive format is dead? Nah, you're just doing it wrong. You can be direct AND be kind and supportive.

title: The 5 Things You Need to Be a Great Leader | Engineering Leadership
description: You want to be a great leader in your software engineering organization? Do these 5 key things consistently.

title: The Magic Number is 7
description: Wondering why your team is not listening to you? Well...they might be listening, but people need to see or hear you SEVEN TIMES before they take action. It doesn't matter if it's a marketing message or an internal communication to your team. Keep at it!

title: Engineering Leader: CTO or VP Engineering?
description: At the top of a software engineering organization, you'll find the CTO and the VP Engineering roles. But what's the difference between them? Here's the way I think about it.

title: Join These Leadership Communities | Engineering Leadership
description: When you're a manager or leader, you will encounter difficult situations constantly. Need help? Turn to these 3 leadership communities; they're phenomenal sounding boards to provide guidance.

title: Start a Business, Step by Step
description: If you're considering starting a business but you're not sure how to get started, I've got a great book to recommend.
